description: Comm Sheet Generator - Master Radio Call Database

calls.text: ATIS: Information [A-Z], Wind [###/##], Altimeter [##.##], Landing/Departing runway [##]
{{Stop1_Airport_Name}} Clearance, {{Call_Sign_Full}}, at [Location/FBO], VFR departure to the [North/South/East/West], request flight following to {{Stop2_Airport_Name}}.
{{Stop1_Airport_Name}} Clearance, {{Call_Sign_Full}}, VFR remaining in the pattern, request.
{{Call_Sign_Abbr}}, contact ground [###.##] when ready to taxi.
{{Stop1_Airport_Name}} Clearance, {{Call_Sign_Full}}, IFR to {{Stop2_Airport_Name}}, ready to copy.
[Center/Approach], {{Call_Sign_Full}}, on the ground at {{Stop1_Airport_Name}}, IFR to {{Stop2_Airport_Name}}, ready to copy.
calls.notes: May not make contact on ground at all locations - terrain/antenna limitations

calls.text: [FSS Name] Radio, {{Call_Sign_Full}}, on [###.##], request IFR clearance relay to {{Stop2_Airport_Name}}.
calls.notes: FSS relay via 122.2 or RCO frequency - used in remote areas

calls.text: {{Call_Sign_Full}}, [FSS Name] Radio, standby for clearance relay.
GCO: Key mic 4 times on [GCO Frequency] to contact ATC, 6 times for FSS.
calls.notes: Ground Communication Outlet - some airports only

calls.text: {{Call_Sign_Full}}, cleared to {{Stop2_Airport_Name}} airport via [Route], [Departure Procedure], climb and maintain [Altitude], expect [Final Altitude] [Time] minutes after departure, departure frequency [###.##], squawk [####].

Cleared to {{Stop2_Airport_Name}} via [Route], [Departure Procedure], climb and maintain [Altitude], expect [Final Altitude] [Time] minutes after departure, departure [###.##], squawk [####], {{Call_Sign_Full}}.
{{Call_Sign_Full}}, clearance void if not off by [Time] Zulu. If not off by [Time] Zulu, advise [Facility] no later than [Time] Zulu of intentions. Time now [Current Time] Zulu.
Clearance void if not off by [Time] Zulu, advise [Facility] no later than [Time] Zulu if not off, {{Call_Sign_Full}}.
{{Call_Sign_Full}}, hold for release, expect release [Time] Zulu.
Option: Depart VFR, pick up IFR clearance in the air.
calls.notes: Common workaround when unable to reach ATC on ground

calls.text: {{Stop1_Airport_Name}} Ground, {{Call_Sign_Full}}, at [Location/FBO], taxi for VFR departure [North/South/East/West], with information [A-Z].
{{Stop1_Airport_Name}} Ground, {{Call_Sign_Full}}, at [Location/FBO], taxi for closed traffic, with information [A-Z].
{{Stop1_Airport_Name}} Ground, {{Call_Sign_Abbr}}, verify cleared to cross runway [##].
{{Stop1_Airport_Traffic}}, {{Call_Sign_Abbr}} holding short runway [##] at [Taxiway] for [Landing Traffic], {{Stop1_Airport_Name}}.

{{Stop1_Airport_Name}} Tower, {{Call_Sign_Abbr}}, holding short runway [##], ready for departure.
{{Stop1_Airport_Name}} Tower, {{Call_Sign_Abbr}}, holding short runway [##], ready for [North/South/East/West] departure.
{{Call_Sign_Abbr}}, runway [##], cleared for takeoff, fly runway heading.
Cleared for takeoff runway [##], fly runway heading, {{Call_Sign_Abbr}}.
{{Stop1_Airport_Name}} Tower, {{Call_Sign_Abbr}}, request intersection departure runway [##] at [Taxiway].
{{Call_Sign_Abbr}}, runway [##] at [Taxiway], cleared for takeoff, [Distance] feet remaining.
{{Call_Sign_Abbr}}, hold your position, advise when ready.
{{Call_Sign_Abbr}}, cancel takeoff clearance, hold your position.
{{Call_Sign_Abbr}}, expedite departure, traffic on [Distance] mile final.
{{Stop1_Airport_Traffic}}, {{Call_Sign_Abbr}} departing runway [##], downwind departure to the [North/South/East/West], {{Stop1_Airport_Name}}.
{{Stop1_Airport_Traffic}}, {{Call_Sign_Abbr}} departing runway [##], remaining in the pattern, closed traffic, {{Stop1_Airport_Name}}.
{{Stop1_Airport_Traffic}}, {{Call_Sign_Abbr}} departing runway [##] for stop and go, {{Stop1_Airport_Name}}.
{{Stop1_Airport_Traffic}}, {{Call_Sign_Abbr}} clear of the pattern to the [North/South/East/West], {{Stop1_Airport_Name}}.

calls.notes: Pop-up IFR - VFR pilot needs clearance due to weather

calls.text: [No standard calls for VFR non-towered climbout]
{{Call_Sign_Full}} is [Type Aircraft], [Miles] miles [North/South/East/West] of {{Stop1_Airport_Name}}, [Altitude], request flight following to {{Stop2_Airport_Name}}.
{{Call_Sign_Abbr}}, traffic [Clock Position] o'clock, [Miles] miles, [North/South/East/West] bound, [Type Aircraft], [Altitude].
{{Call_Sign_Abbr}}, traffic no longer a factor, resume own navigation.
[Center], {{Call_Sign_Abbr}}, pilot report. [Location], [Time], [Altitude], [Type Aircraft]. [Sky Cover], [Visibility], Temp [Temp], Wind [###/##], [Turbulence/Icing].
Mayday, Mayday, Mayday. [Center], {{Call_Sign_Full}} declaring an emergency. [Nature of Emergency]. [Location], [Altitude]. [Souls on Board], [Fuel in Time]. Intentions [Intentions].
[Center], {{Call_Sign_Full}} declaring an emergency. [Nature of Emergency]. [Location], [Altitude]. [Souls on Board], [Fuel in Time]. Intentions [Intentions].
Pan-Pan, Pan-Pan, Pan-Pan. [Center], {{Call_Sign_Full}} has [Nature of Urgency], request [Priority Handling/Diversion].
[Center], {{Call_Sign_Abbr}}, airport in sight, cancel flight following.
{{Call_Sign_Abbr}}, radar service terminated, squawk VFR, frequency change approved.
{{Call_Sign_Abbr}}, frequency change approved, report back this frequency.
Frequency change approved, will report back, {{Call_Sign_Abbr}}.
Note: Set altimeter to 29.92 when climbing through FL180.
[Center], {{Call_Sign_Abbr}}, request deviation [Left/Right] of course for weather.
{{Call_Sign_Abbr}}, deviation approved, advise when able direct [Fix].

IFR PIREP Prompt (Cloud Layers):
In cloud [Altitude] to [Altitude]:
Between layers [Altitude] to [Altitude]:
Topped clouds at [Altitude]:
Icing observed:
Turbulence:

calls.notes: Required when radar contact lost or in non-radar environment
Not an emergency, but advises ATC that any undue delay will result in emergency fuel status
Attempt on current frequency if suspecting lost comm
Try guard frequency 121.5 if no response

calls.text: Lost Comm: Squawk 7600, fly route assigned/expected/filed, altitude highest of assigned/expected/MEA.
{{Call_Sign_Abbr}}, hold [Direction] of [Fix] on the [Radial/Course], [Leg Length] mile legs, expect further clearance [Time] Zulu.
Hold [Direction] of [Fix] on the [Radial/Course], [Leg Length] mile legs, expect further clearance [Time] Zulu, {{Call_Sign_Abbr}}.
{{Call_Sign_Abbr}}, hold as published at [Fix], expect further clearance [Time] Zulu.
Hold as published at [Fix], expect further clearance [Time] Zulu, {{Call_Sign_Abbr}}.
[Center], {{Call_Sign_Abbr}}, request updated expect further clearance time.
ATIS: Information [A-Z], Wind [###/##], Altimeter [##.##], Landing runway [##]

Arrival Brief:
Destination:
Expected runway:
Pattern entry:
Traffic pattern altitude:
Parking/FBO:
{{Stop2_Airport_Name}} Approach, {{Call_Sign_Full}}, [Miles] miles [North/South/East/West], [Altitude], inbound for landing with information [A-Z].

calls.notes: Contact approach - pilot must request, 1 mile vis, clear of clouds

calls.text: [Approach], {{Call_Sign_Abbr}}, request pilot reports for conditions on final.
{{Stop2_Airport_Name}} Tower, {{Call_Sign_Full}}, [Miles] miles [North/South/East/West], inbound for landing with information [A-Z].
{{Stop2_Airport_Name}} Tower, {{Call_Sign_Full}}, [Miles] miles [North/South/East/West], inbound for closed traffic with information [A-Z].
{{Call_Sign_Abbr}}, extend downwind, I'll call your base.
{{Call_Sign_Abbr}}, extend upwind, I'll call your crosswind.
{{Call_Sign_Abbr}}, approved as requested, report full stop.
Approved as requested, will report full stop, {{Call_Sign_Abbr}}.

calls.notes: Self-announce on CTAF when on final approach at non-towered

calls.text: Minimums, [Runway in Sight / Runway Not in Sight].

{{Call_Sign_Abbr}}, [Miles] miles from [Fix], turn [Left/Right] heading [Heading], maintain [Altitude] until established, cleared [ILS/RNAV] runway [##] approach.
[Left/Right] heading [Heading], maintain [Altitude] until established, cleared [ILS/RNAV] runway [##] approach, {{Call_Sign_Abbr}}.
{{Call_Sign_Abbr}}, fly heading [Heading], intercept the final approach course runway [##].
Heading [Heading], intercept final approach course runway [##], {{Call_Sign_Abbr}}.
{{Call_Sign_Abbr}}, cleared [Approach Type] runway [##] approach, circle to land runway [##].
Cleared [Approach Type] runway [##] approach, circle to land runway [##], {{Call_Sign_Abbr}}.
{{Call_Sign_Abbr}}, cleared [Approach Type] runway [##] approach, sidestep to runway [##].
Cleared [Approach Type] runway [##] approach, sidestep runway [##], {{Call_Sign_Abbr}}.
{{Call_Sign_Abbr}}, change to advisory frequency approved, cancel IFR on this frequency or on the ground.
Advisory frequency, will cancel on the ground, {{Call_Sign_Abbr}}.
{{Call_Sign_Abbr}}, wind [###] at [##], runway [##], cleared to land.
{{Call_Sign_Abbr}}, wind [###] at [##], runway [##], cleared to land, hold short of wind [###] at [##], runway [##], [Distance] feet available.
Cleared to land runway [##], hold short runway [##], {{Call_Sign_Abbr}}.
{{Call_Sign_Abbr}}, expedite clearing runway, traffic on short final.

calls.notes: Cancel in the air if VFR conditions exist - releases airspace immediately

calls.text: {{Call_Sign_Abbr}}, IFR cancellation received, squawk VFR, frequency change approved.
{{Stop2_Airport_Name}} Ground, {{Call_Sign_Abbr}}, clear of runway [##], taxi to [Parking/FBO/Ramp].
{{Stop2_Airport_Name}} UNICOM, {{Call_Sign_Abbr}} request fuel at the pumps.
[Approach/Center/FSS], {{Call_Sign_Full}}, on the ground at {{Stop2_Airport_Name}}, cancel IFR.
calls.notes: Must cancel IFR on ground if not cancelled in air - critical for releasing airspace

calls.text: Parking brake set, avionics off, mixture cutoff.
[Center/Approach], {{Call_Sign_Full}} declaring an emergency. [Location], [Altitude]. [Nature of Emergency]. [Souls on Board] souls, [Fuel Remaining] fuel. Request [Intentions].
Mayday, Mayday, Mayday. [Center/Approach], {{Call_Sign_Full}}. [Location], [Altitude]. [Nature of Emergency]. [Souls on Board] souls, [Fuel Remaining] fuel. Request [Intentions].
Pan-Pan, Pan-Pan, Pan-Pan. [Center/Approach], {{Call_Sign_Full}}. [Location], [Altitude]. [Nature of Urgency]. Request [Request].

calls.notes: Advisory only - not an emergency declaration but alerts ATC to priority handling

calls.text: [Center/Approach], {{Call_Sign_Full}}, VFR pilot in IMC conditions, request assistance, [Altitude], [Heading].
